author: bmwlego
title: Stunt Chopper
review: Great little promo set. It actually looks like it could have been sold by itself for about 2 bucks. It includes a pilot minifig and specialty pieces such as a propeller, copter rotors, an extra visor for the helmet, and 2 1x6 bars that connect teh landing gear to the copter body. The alternate models include a small stunt plane, a row boat with dock and a small watercraft. Not a bad set at all.

author: Daaryl
title: Small, yet fun set
review: After buying a legoland lot on ebay, I had received a couple "minisets" that were included in the sale.  "Stunt Chopper" was one of them, and I think that it is the best of the four from the stunt series.  It is small obviously, but it will fit into a Lego City set very nicely.  If you don't have this I would recommend trying to get it for a couple dollars on ebay or build it with online instructions.

author: stitchfan
title: The first one is always free...
review:
Possibly the best Kellogg's promotions ever, Sets 1560, 1561, 1562, and 1563 were the sets I remember most vividly as a kid. Probably because my thrifty mom earned me about 3 of each through this Promo. I still have the unmistakable parts floating through around Lego my bins after all these years, and they're still as useful.

Pros

  • Free Lego sets!
  • Simple sets, good parts
  • Great for beginners just starting with Lego
  • Good for play time, since they come with mini figures and moving parts

Cons


  • Not many parts to work with, leaving limited re-build options as stand-alone sets
  • Simplicity and few parts might leave the experienced Lego builder uninterested

Let's just hope Kellogg's (or someone) has a deal this good again in the future!
